before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"dn5es","text":"This protocol describes the amplification of the VP1 sequence, sample barcoding and library preparation. We anticipate users will have performed an RNA extraction prior to this protocol to extract Poliovirus RNA. We recommend either the Roche High Pure Viral RNA Kit (with added proteinase K), QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit or the MagMAX Viral RNA Isolation Kit for this process as fragmentation of the RNA will prevent successful amplification during the panEV PCR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arv6h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di61m","text":"PanEV primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dbn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d07a","text":"For the initial RT-PCR, uses the PanEV primers 5’NTR [TGGCGGAACCGACTACTTTGGGTG] and Cre [TCAATACGGTGTTTGCTCTTGAACTG] (Arita et al, 2015)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":124,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"614pf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e4g7","text":"For nOPV2 detection a second Reverse primer, nOPV2-R, should be mixed with Cre in equal quantities to make up a 10 µM working solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anrjp","text":"nOPV2-R [TCGATACGGTGCTTGGATTTAAATTG]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4umbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qa6i","text":"Barcoded VP1 Primers ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h4f2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5j7l","text":"For high throughout sequencing in 96 well plates we recommend the purchase and assembly of 96-well primer plate with 10 µM of barcoded Y7 primer and 10 µM of barcoded Q8 primer in each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q18q","text":"Each well contains Q8 and Y7 primers with the same unique barcode e.g A1 = Y7 with barcode 1 and Q8 with barcode 1, A2 = Y7 with barcode 2 and Q8 with barcode 2, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ssbq","text":"Primer structure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f05pr","text":"Forward primer: Y7_VP1_BC#GGTGCTG########################TTAACCTGGGTTTGTGTCAGCCTGTAATGA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2gjs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pt2a","text":"Reverse Primer: Q8_VP1_BC#","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nipr","text":"GGTGCTG########################TTAACCTAAGAGGTCTCTRTTCCACAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"641rm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79cim","text":"Barcode sequences as Nanopore ligation sequencing barcodes and as shown in Shaw et al, 2020. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"an7d","text":"This protocol is updated from the protocol described in the paper \"Rapid and sensitive direct detection and identification of poliovirus from stool and environmental surveillance samples using nanopore sequencing\" by Shaw et al  in the Journal of Clinical Microbiology (2020), DOI: 10.1128/JCM.00920-20. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":222,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g794","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sj1v","text":"The protocol aims to amplify the VP1 region of poliovirus through a nested PCR using panEV primers followed by amplification of the VP1 sequence using the Q8/Y7 primer set. We advise the use of barcoded primers where possible as this greatly simplifies the subsequent library preparation process. Additional steps have however been included in the case that the second PCR step is performed either with standard Q8/Y7 primers or using Q8/Y7 with the barcode adaptors (BCA) attached. Primer sequences for the panEV primers, Q8/Y7 primers and modified Q8/Y7 primers are found in Dataset S1 of the publication. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cg5d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c07b6","text":"Sequencing of the panEV product is also possible through the removal of the VP1 nested PCR steps and the preparation of the panEV product for sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7agrd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hv60","text":"Version updates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq8j3","text":"v1.1 – Updated to LSK-109","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"873tl","text":"v1.2 – Minor formatting edits","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9npn9","text":"v1.3 – Streamlining and minor alterations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eag91","text":"v1.4 – Written inclusion of negative control in PCR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gcoa","text":"v1.5 – Updated to dreamtaq and Y7R primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fjj","text":"v1.6 – Updated MinKNOW instructions \u0026 minor edits","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90spb","text":"v1.7 – Changed back to Y7 primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeaps","text":"v1.10 – Updated to LSK-110, removed cleaning and quantification prior to pooling, updated taq volume in rtPCR, altered nested VP1 to use neat panEV product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj8h3","text":"V1.11 – Updated RNA extraction to include Proteinase K, removed DNA CS addition, added pooling of Y7/Q8 primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ks6h","text":"Steps 29 onwards are based on protocols from Oxford Nanopore Technologies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Rapid and sensitive direct detection and identification of poliovirus from stool and environmental surveillance samples using nanopore sequencing, Journal of Clinical Microbiology, 2020. DOI: 10.1128/JCM.00920-20

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ddcdj","text":"Briefly vortex and centrifuge down. Add 19 µL of master mix to each PCR tube and 5 µL of eluted RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3daoa","text":"Incubate at 50 °C for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4r6ie","text":"Add 1 µL of the forward primer to the tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR First Round (PanEV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"54pep","text":"Amplify using the following cycling conditions:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pmep","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ufcr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vvgv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7u0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cnps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[50,179,50,"159"],"data":[["CYCLE","STEP","TEMP (°C)","TIME"],["1","Initial Denaturation","94","2 minutes"],["42","Denaturation","94","15 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","68","4 minutes 30 seconds*"],["1","Final Extension","68","5 minutes "],["-","Hold","10","-"]],"guid":"11E7FCF093A311EA9E4A5198AB7B7D64","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8bj47","text":"* Extension time for panEV amplification","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":{"A_3":[1,3]},"printData":[["CYCLE","STEP","TEMP (°C)","TIME"],["1","Initial Denaturation","94","2 minutes"],["42","Denaturation","94","15 seconds"],["","Annealing","55","30 seconds"],["","Extension","68","4 minutes 30 seconds*"],["1","Final Extension","68","5 minutes "],["-","Hold","10","-"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6fn6","text":"VP1 amplification is performed using the Q8/Y7 primers. These can be modified to remove library preperation steps as shown in Shaw et al  2020, DOI: 10.1128/JCM.00920-20. The basic PCR uses the primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":131,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biuie","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs7h4","text":"Forward Primer (Y7): GGGTTTGTGTCAGCCTGTAATGA (Kilpatrick et al. 2011)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"883l2","text":"Reverse Primer (Q8): AAGAGGTCTCTRTTCCACAT (Yang et al. 1992)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8si2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo9ho","text":"These can be replaced with either Q8/Y7 primers with barcodes attached (sequences in Dataset_S1 of Shaw et al  2020). We recommend premixing these primers in a 96 well plate, with 10 µM forward primer and 10 µM of reverse primer in each well.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":104,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9blmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7i2c","text":"Prepare a Master mix using reaction volumes as detailed below, excluding the diluted PCR product (and primers if these are barcoded): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55be4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hk0d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"gme7","text":"* Previous protocol editions have used a 5 µL of a 1 in 20 dilution of the PCR product (5 µL in 100 µL nuclease free water); we find that 2 µL of the neat product works as well, if not better, and reduces the potential for contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[224,50],"data":[["","1 Reaction (µL)"],["DreamTaq 2x master mix","12.5"],["Water","8.5"],["Forward primer (10 µM)","1"],["Reverse primer (10 µM)","1"],["PCR product","2*"],["Total volume","25"]],"guid":"4ADE023093A211EA9E4A5198AB7B7D64","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["","1 Reaction (µL)"],["DreamTaq 2x master mix","12.5"],["Water","8.5"],["Forward primer (10 µM)","1"],["Reverse primer (10 µM)","1"],["PCR product","2*"],["Total volume","25"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cntpd","text":"Briefly vortex and centrifuge down the master mix and aliquot 20 µL into each PCR tube (or 18 µL if using barcoded primers).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftnpl","text":"Add 2 µL of  premixed forward and reverse primers if necessary (i.e. if using barcoded VP1 primers).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Nested PCR Round 2 (VP1)

steps.section: Library Preparation for the ONT MinION: Pooling and adapting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3tvln","text":"Adaptor ligation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dshn0","text":"Thaw and prepare the kit reagents as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bra36","text":"Spin down and thaw Adapter Mix (AMX-F) on ice ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tm6d","text":"Spin down T4 Ligase from NEBNext Quick Ligation Module (E6056) on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c041n","text":"Thaw Ligation Buffer (LNB) at room temperature, spin down, mix by pipetting. Place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5biac","text":"Thaw Elution Buffer (EB) at room temperature, mix by vortexing, spin down. Place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ihgt","text":"Thaw one tube of S Fragment Buffer (SFB)* for VP1 at room temperature, mix by vortexing, spin down and place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl42n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cre7r","text":"*For panEV sequencing, use L Fragment Buffer (LFB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library Preparation for the ONT MinION: Pooling and adapting
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ab4sf","text":"AMPure XP cleanup:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7tbbq","text":"Prepare the AMPure XP beads for use; resuspend by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fcfar","text":"Add 40 µL of resuspended AMPure XP beads to the adapter ligation reaction from the previous step and mix by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"di0i8","text":"Incubate on a rotator for 5 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f1v8t","text":"Place on magnetic rack, allow beads to pellet and pipette off supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lfcd","text":"Add 250 μL of the LFB/SFB to the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6p7pc","text":"Close the tube lid and resuspend the beads by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9kbm8","text":"Return the tube to the magnetic rack, allow beads to pellet and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"al7ie","text":"Add 250 μL of the LFB/SFB to the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1orci","text":"Close the tube lid and resuspend the beads by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"38lb6","text":"Return the tube to the magnetic rack, allow beads to pellet and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1tkcd","text":"Spin down the tube and place back on the magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6j9i8","text":"Pipette off residual supernatant and briefly air dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4vf1p","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 15 µl Elution Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e5p2g","text":"Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98v36","text":"Pellet beads on magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19sln","text":"Remove and retain the eluate which contains the DNA library in a clean 1.5 mL Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5q1p","text":"Thaw the Sequencing Buffer (SQB), Loading Beads (LB), Flush Tether (FLT) and one tube of Flush Buffer (FLB) at room temperature before placing the tubes on ice as soon as thawing is complete.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":111,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64llj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60uhp","text":"Mix the Sequencing Buffer (SQB) and Flush Buffer (FLB) tubes by vortexing, spin down and return to ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"454oe","text":"Spin down the Flush Tether (FLT) tube, mix by pipetting, and return to ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa1va","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dppho","text":"Start the sequencing run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abvir","text":"Open the lid of the nanopore sequencing device and slide the flow cell's priming port cover clockwise so that the priming port is visible. After opening the priming port, check for small bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to remove any bubble (a few µLs). Visually check that there is continuous buffer from the priming port across the sensor array.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":299,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37b96","text":"Load 800 µL of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles. Wait for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3qg5","text":"Thoroughly mix the contents of the LB tube by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"84jau","text":"In a new tube, prepare the library for loading as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dfaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lbk9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"coea7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["340","195"],"data":[["Reagent","Volume (µL)"],["Sequencing Buffer (SQB)","37.5"],["Loading Beads (LB), mixed immediately before use","25.5"],["DNA library","12"],["Total","75"]],"guid":"F352EE50988A11ECA3651136C794C679","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume (µL)"],["Sequencing Buffer (SQB)","37.5"],["Loading Beads (LB), mixed immediately before use","25.5"],["DNA library","12"],["Total","75"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdj92","text":"Complete the flow cell priming:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6art","text":"Gently lift the SpotON sample port cover to make the SpotON sample port accessible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dog6d","text":"Load 200 µL of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port (not the SpotON sample port), avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lchn","text":"Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just prior to loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apr0l","text":"Add 75 μl of sample to the flow cell via the SpotON sample port in a dropwise fashion. Ensure each drop flows into the port before adding the next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Priming and loading the SpotON Flow Cell
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9dn37","text":"Gently replace the SpotON sample port cover, making sure the bung enters the SpotON port, close the priming port and replace the MinION lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
